title.narrative: Roll out the National Results Based Financing Policy in the Acholi Sub-Region, Uganda (USAID EHA)

description.narrative:
The intervention UGA180371T “Roll out the National Results Based Financing Policy in the Acholi Sub-Region, Uganda” (USAID EHA) implements the Result Based Financing (RBF) Policy, which shifts the accent from input-based financing of health facilities to output-based financing. RBF rewards health facilities in cash or provides equipment and materials if pre-defined results have been achieved. It also subsidises fees for patients and provides incentives to health workers. RBF payments allow the health facilities to reinvest the revenue and provide new and better quality health services.
The intervention stimulates both the demand and supply sides of the health services market. It encourages individuals, households and communities to receive quality health services and vaccines, and health workers to deliver good quality health services. Simply put, “the money follows the patient”. If a health facility attracts more patients and provides better quality services in a cost-efficient way – it receives more performance-based incentives. This results an increase of availability of medicines, vaccines, and medical equipment and better accessibility of health services.
At the level of Government of Uganda (GoU) and MoH, the intervention contributes to nationwide implementation of National RBF Framework, bringing of RBF and health insurance on the agenda of health system reforms, and strengthening of cooperation between Health Development Partners (HDP). At the level of DLG, DHO, DHMT, MB, and HF, the intervention contributes to positive changes in the strategic areas of health service utilisation, health system management, financial management, human resources, medicines and health supplies, data quality and use.
